sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Computes the complimentary error function for real arguments. The erfc function takes only a single argument y = erfc(x) where x is either a float or double array. The output vector y is the same size (and type) as x.

sect1.title: Internals
sect1.para: The erfc function is defined by the integral: \[ \mathrm{erfc}(x) = \frac{2}{\sqrt{\pi}}\int_{x}^{\infty} e^{-t^2} \, dt, \] and is the integral of the normal distribution.

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: Here is a plot of the erfc function over the range [-5,5].
